info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CIBOLA AND NORTHWESTERN VALENCIA COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 209 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles south of Mesita, or 18 miles south of Laguna Pueblo, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesita. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 120 and 122. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
